intro: Pedilonum lancilabium, commonly known as the slender-lipped pedilonum, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Pedilonaceae and is characterized by its delicate, elongated petals and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat destruction, Pedilonum lancilabium is considered endangered and requires protection to ensure its survival.
